results.title: Dragonwyk
results.creator_credit: Darryl F. Zanuck, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F Zanuck Productions and Joseph L Mankiewicz
results.brief_description: Brooding, gothic thriller about a beautiful, naive country girl whose dreams of a grander life are realised with her sophisticated and urbane cousin who resides at the palatial estate, “Dragonwyck”. Dazzled by his social mobility and wealth, Miranda is soon betrothed to the faintly menacing Nicholas, but the marriage becomes wretched as Nicholas’ true nature is revealed. Shades of “Rebecca” (1940) hang over this mystery drama, but the Hitcockian tones are diluted in favour of a more romantic tone. What remains is an engaging, and at times suspenseful, murder mystery. Directorial debut of screenwriter and producer Joseph L. Mankiewicz.

results.title: Dragons tongue. - Series 2.
results.creator_credit: Robin James, Asian Studies Council, Griffith University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: A series of lessons in the Chinese language intended for high school students using simple vocabulary and brief dramatisations utilising the vocabulary. Includes short sections about life in modern China and a segment on Chinese writing and calligraphy. Introduced by Colin McKerras.

results.title: Dragonheart
results.creator_credit: Raffaella De Laurentiis, Universal Pictures and Rob Cohen
results.brief_description: Bowen (Quaid) is a knight dedicated to the Old Code, a noble creed of honour in a time long ago when majestic fire breathers soared through the skies. Bowen dedicates his time to instructing worthy pupils of the Old Code. He is disillusioned when one of his pupils, Prince Einon, becomes a cruel King, and Bowen loses faith in the idealism that was once the source of his inner strength. Believing Einon’s soul to have been poisoned by a dragon, Bowen vows to destroy all dragons - without question or mercy. It is on this revenge quest for the good soul of Prince Einon that Bowen meets Draco (voice provided by Sean Connery), a dragon whose power, strength and wit are not easily defeated. As man and dragon contest in a life or death struggle, a friendship is formed that will change the face of the medieval world forever. Cast includes Dennis Quaid, David Thewlis, Pete Postlethwaite, Julie Christie and Dina Meyer.

results.brief_description: Traces the history of Australian housing designs from the time of penal settlements to the beginning of this century, and explains why certain styles of housing evolved.

results.title: Dragon lord = Long shaoye
results.creator_credit: Leonard Ho, Golden Harvest and Jackie Chan
results.brief_description: In this, the third in a trilogy of early films that Jackie Chan both directed and starred in, Chan refines his screen persona of the precocious, mischievious kung fu kid. Despite his comic buffoonery, when it comes to the crunch his highly honed martial arts skills save the day. Like the previous films in the trilogy (“The Fearless Hyena” (1979), “The Young Master” (1980)), ‘Dragon Lord’ is set in the countryside during the late Quing period. Chan plays the son of a wealthy man. He and his childhood friend spend their time participating in sporting events and competing to woo the village beauty. His carefree life takes a more serious turn when he stumbles upon a sinister villain who is attempting to smuggle priceless antiquities out of the country. The film features thrilling sporting sequences, a suspenseful rooftop encounter with a group of spear-wielding baddies, a playful acrobatic fight in an art gallery, and a show-stopping twenty minute final brawl that is a classic of Hong Kong action cinema. While not considered one of Chan’s best films, the over-the-top comic action sequences, featuring crazy stunts and rapid editing he pioneered in ‘Dragon Lord’ had a major impact on the subsequent development of Hong Kong action cinema. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Dragon's tongue
results.creator_credit: Maija Rove, Asian Studies Council, Griffith University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: A series of lessons in the Chinese language intended for high school students who have studied Chinese for two years. Each lesson includes some simple vocabulary, calligraphy, brief dramatisations which utilise the vocabulary and short sections on life in modern China. Introduced by Colin McKerras.
